items.catalyzed_reaction: NADP(H)-dependent oxidation of alcohols and reduction of aldehydes/ketones.
items.formulation: All purification steps performed in TEA–HCl buffer (50 mmol L-1, pH 7.5), supplemented with CaCl2 (0–0.8 mmol L-1) as needed. Storage tested in desalting buffer (TEA–HCl, 10 mmol L-1, pH 7.5) at 8°C or -20°C, or in 50% (v/v) glycerol/desalting buffer at -20°C, or as freeze-dried enzyme at -20°C.
items.name: RADH (alcohol dehydrogenase from Ralstonia sp.)
items.purification_method: Size exclusion chromatography (SEC) for desalting (initial), anion exchange chromatography, followed by a second SEC for salt exchange/storage buffer adjustment.
items.purity_specification: SDS–PAGE (4–12% NuPAGE Novex Bis–Tris gel), stained with SimplyBlue SafeStain or SilverXpress Silver Stain; estimation by SDS–PAGE.
items.special_treatment: For storage stability tests: compared four methods—storage in desalting buffer at 8°C, at -20°C, with 50% glycerol at -20°C, or freeze-dried at -20°C; activity measurements conducted over time using a standard reduction assay. CaCl2 added to buffers for improved stability (0.2–0.8 mmol L-1 depending on step).
